website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if you want an overall nice bike that's built for a comfortable, casual ride in the park, on paved paths, or lightly traveled roads. It's also easy to assemble unless you run into issues with the derailleur gears.
pros: A versatile bike that's made for leisure, and is comfortable to ride with a spacious seat and excellent shock absorption
cons: A few owners griped that the derailleur gears weren't adjusted when the bike arrived, and performing this task is tricky
A bit more sluggish than other models we considered

customer_reviews.title: The new bike is considerably lighter than the old one and has many nice features. Shifting is very easy and the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike to replace my 20 year old Diamondback Wildwood. The new bike is considerably lighter than the old one and has many nice features. Shifting is very easy and the bike is very comfortable to ride. This may be the last bike I ever purchase, assuming it is as durable as my old one (I do a lot of riding!)
customer_reviews.author: J. Koch

customer_reviews.title: Wow , what a great bargain from Amazon a diamondback for less than $150
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale at a ridiculously low price to replace my old trek mountain bike for around town riding. I can not believe they can make such a quality bike available for less than $150. surprisingly light, smooth reliable shifting, excellent brakes and handling. the frame size does seem a bit smaller than expected but not crazy off. seat mount feels a little too far forward for a 19" frame, but just a bit. I will see if it actually holds up to use as well as a more expensive bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: 1techguy

customer_reviews.title: Buy the next frame size up.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike for the money. Seating geometry feels off though. Lots of energy needed to pedal. I should have got the 19 or even 21 inch model. I am only 5 foot 9 but the 17 feels too small.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ray

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, Assembly went well and it a comfy ride for and old guy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The seat is horrible but I think all bike seats are horrible
customer_reviews.text: The bike came with a bent wheel but the bike shop fixed it for me. The seat is horrible but I think all bike seats are horrible. I love the bike. The gears are easy and the handle bars are perfect. And the color is eye-catching. Everyone that has seen this bike comments on the color and how nice it looks and rides. I ride mostly on dirt trails ..
customer_reviews.author: stegacosa

customer_reviews.title: I love my hobbies
customer_reviews.text: I replace just about everything on the bike, not that anything needed replacement. The frame is rather light and the finished product is an outlier. Look at the geometry of the thing with the low seat tube and the huge head tube with the adjustable stem. I put handlebars on with a 5.25 inch rise and I can ride it literally upright, at 6 feet, 2 inches ... I love my hobbies.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Bendheim, M.D.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this bike
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 55-year old casual rider. This was a good bike at a good price for me. I've ridden it about 20 times with no problems. I'm fairly handy, but it took me awhile to assemble. Instructions and pictures could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike at an economy price
customer_reviews.text: Good cruiser bike for around town or on modest trails. Assembly is pretty straightforward, with 3 Allen wrenches supplied to work all the bolts needed to put the bike together and adjust it to your fit. The reflectors don't seem to be a very good match, but I made them work. This is a stripped down bike without fenders or kickstand. I added both. A standard center-mounted kickstand fit fine. I got a back fender to minimize road grime on my back from riding on wet roads (it rains here a lot). Its a good bike from a reputable company, at an entry-level price.
customer_reviews.author: AKMonkeyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike for the price, very light weight. Rear derailleur was bent, but I was able to bend it back into shape. Little finicky to dial in derailers, other wise went together with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: No kickstand
customer_reviews.text: great bike,easy assembly,guess i am old school,i would really like for it to have come with a kickstand!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great bike and value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and well made bike and a great value too. Received bike partially assembled was easy to complete assembly. Great bike for trails and road, seat hard on the bottom after riding a while so will probably get softer seat eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Great City Bike
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with this purchase and I should say this is the most comfortable bike I've ever had. The shifting ratios are perfect for cities and you can easily count on it on uphills. I ordered L size even though I am 6'2" and that's because they had run out of XL size, but I'm really happy to have it!
customer_reviews.author: Hossein Haeri

customer_reviews.title: weather took a turn for the worse but did get out one day
customer_reviews.text: Not much chance to ride, weather took a turn for the worse but did get out one day. Easy enough to assemble if you have some mechanical skills. Lots of helpful information on Diamondback's website.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable bike I have ever owned. I could no longer comfortably ride my road bike and transitioned to this very comfortable cruiser. I can finally enjoy biking again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L

customer_reviews.title: Good ride
customer_reviews.text: Great bike out of the box for a recreational rider. Got rear gears changed out for $60 And this made my bike super
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable bike
customer_reviews.text: Open the box and fairly easy set up, I am familiar with bike assembly. The bike is well built, comfortable and everything works well. I love it and will buy one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Abner M. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift and they are very happy with it. It was easy to assemble and rides very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: The One

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: Bike in a box arrived and 30 minutes later I was riding down bike paths. Took longer to remove all the packaging tie wraps than to finish the assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent get around town bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Excellent get around town bicycle; although I would not be afraid to take it on a trip, Frame welds are good and the greenish paint very slightly changes hue under certain lighting conditions. Bike is very well made for something in this price range. I'm an engineer and it was "fairly easy" for me to assemble and adjust; If you are not mechanically inclined and do not have experience with bicycle assembly and adjustment; I would recommend taking it to a bike shop or getting an experienced friend to help.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice bicycle for comfortable riding on streets, bike paths, or light trails. Solid and well made. Good component quality. Easy to shift and very nice ride. For the money, it would be hard to beat. Be sure to check out and follow the sizing chart.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Grizzard

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable bike
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and comfortable to ride. Easy to ride sitting upright instead of hunched over like many trail bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece, I can’t use it yet. It looks great, though.
customer_reviews.text: Missing the piece to attach the seat to the frame. Bike looks great, though. I can buy the missing piece, not a big deal but it is kind of a waste of time for me. I ordered online to avoid going to the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Naxieli Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bike and good value for the money. I ride it as often as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Race Car Fan

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as advertised. The bike arrived in a timely fashion undamaged. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for entire family
customer_reviews.text: The overtorqued handlebar adjustment hex bolt is stuck forever, the left pedal thread was poorly machined so it needed brute force to rethread the aluminum lever with the pedal (I suspect it will outlast the bike). I bought a third party kickstand, lights, and bottleholder. The bike is great for my 9,12, and 14yo kids, the little one had a great time learning to ride on it, now I may have to get a second bike. I also rode on it, very comfortable, the gears are logical and climbs anything, love the suspension on the saddle and front. You get what you pay for, and this bike shines.
customer_reviews.author: EV4Life

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great bike, bought for my wife. easy to set up, good quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: sandro

customer_reviews.title: Great product as long as you don’t need help from Diamondback
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike, but warranty service has been poor. Shipped with missing parts and still waiting after a week to get a response on my claim.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: not much assembly very good quality i'm super satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Phil Fraley

customer_reviews.title: Not Good. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The brakes were all messed up and the wheels are seriuosly warped. Rims are not remotely balanced. Box says Made in China. I would rather it say Made in Taiwan - I'd probably get better quality. Returned it. I would not recommend this bike to anyone. I'd probably get a better deal at a big box retailer. I'll check to see how good or bad a bike at a store is regarding wheel balance.
customer_reviews.author: Richard CSUF MSA, Wisconsin MBA

customer_reviews.title: shift gearing worked great.
customer_reviews.text: steering head and front wheel bearings were too tight. foot pedals had no grip. shift gearing worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good riding bike
customer_reviews.text: Good riding bike. Rides smooth. Gears change nicely. Comfortable. I added a gel seat cover for additional comfort. Easy enough assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The ride was comfortable. I will add more to this review after ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 17"/MD bike I am 6' tall and with a 30" inseam and this bike seems to fit me well. When it got here the rear derailleur cable and front brake cable had been pinched, they still function but that is why I only gave 4 stars. Shipping box was slightly damaged but I saw no damage to the bike due to the box damage. I rode it for just a short time after assembly, putting stuff together and fixing things is my profession so assembly was not hard. The ride was comfortable. I will add more to this review after I log some miles on this bike.
customer_reviews.author: joe slussar

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't believe how nice it looks when I open the box
customer_reviews.text: For the price "awsome", I couldn't believe how nice it looks when I open the box, easy to assamble, great bike!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product Poor packaging beware !
customer_reviews.text: I like this bike the product is decent but the packaging is very bad ,the box arrived broken with missing tools, the assembly instructions are not clear, bad experiences in general, better buy in a specialized store
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Was disappointed that I received a returnes item
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed that I received a returnes item. The return slip was in the box. im 5'7 and purchased the medium. Its comfy, shifts easy, rides upright and comfy. the bike felt compact, my knees hurt even after adjusting the saddle. Wheels were out of true, brake cable sleeces were damaged and brake felt spongy.
customer_reviews.author: H.D.

customer_reviews.title: It's A Comfort Bike
customer_reviews.text: If you want to sit upright and not go over 20 mph, this is probably the bike for you.
customer_reviews.author: NoneOfYourBeezwax

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: I seriously love this bike. I passed it up the first time looking at it because I hated the color and was hoping to find something cheaper. After buying 2 other bikes, I came back to buy this one - and I'm glad I did. We do 10-15 mile rides at a time and it is the best in the group. Had a friend borrow it on a ride recently and she couldn't stop talking about how smooth the ride is.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Cooksey

customer_reviews.title: Great but one wheel is smaller
customer_reviews.text: Well the one issue with the bike is one of the wheels is smaller than the other and when you have a 70 year riding a bike he will notice how much harder it is too ride, also the seat could be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Just started riding my new bike.
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a good value. Appears to have quality parts and construction. Yes, there's some assembly but if you're a bit handy with an Allen wrench you should be successful. Break assembly was a bit of a challenge. I really like the adjustable handlebars and fat seat. I'm an older rider and the bike is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: gregory a shugard

customer_reviews.title: so good. A little heavier than I expected
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. A little heavier than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: DFox

customer_reviews.title: Open box / returned item
customer_reviews.text: I like the bike. However I am much less happy with the purchase. I received an open box or returned item that was advertised as new. The box was previously opened and re-packaged. Scratches on the frame, broken thread on one of the bolts, damaged cables, all indicating that someone was assembling it before. I decided not to go through the hassle of returning this big package but still have a bad feeling about this purchase of otherwise good bike.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Zaytsev

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money.  It came all tied up in knots, so it is of no use whatesoever.  I'll throw it away.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the money. I looked at many, but this has the best price and features.
customer_reviews.author: Korgy

customer_reviews.title: Not able to ride right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, however, unless you are able to spend several hours on youtube and the internet, it is difficult to adjust the derailleurs as delivered. Poor quality control. I just assumed it should have been adjusted for riding out of the box, but it is not and most likely you would need to take it to a bike shop.
customer_reviews.author: sarajn316

product_meta.title: Diamondback Bicycles Wildwood Classic Comfort Bike
product_meta.description: Our longest-running city bike returns better than ever: the wildwood classic is comfortable, practical, and affordable. The perfect bike for enjoying fresh air on spontaneous rides, it's designed to be as USER-FRIENDLY as possible. It's unintimidating and familiar with a suspension fork and seat post to soak up bumps big and small. It's easy to personalize your fit with the adjustable stem and comfy seat, and with crisp Shimano easy fire shifting through 21 speeds, you'll always be in the right gear. For quick rides or weekend jaunts, the wildwood classic can't be beat.
feature_bullets: Heat treated aluminum alloy frame is built to last
Comfort geometry for perfect pedaling position
Suspension fork and seat post for added cushioning
21-speed drivetrain provides wide range of gears

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
